title: Security Engineer
description:
Are you looking to:

Make meaningful changes at the fastest-growing tech company in Japan?
Work in a fair, highly flexible, and inclusive environment where anyone can make an impact?
Build the next bold idea in conversational commerce technology?

We Are Zeals – “Designing conversations. Driving conversions.”

Zeals is changing how consumers purchase online through AI-powered, human-designed conversation flows. With over 480 enterprise clients in Japan and nearly $40 million in recent funding (backed by Salesforce Ventures), we are poised for exponential growth in the US and global markets. Our goal is simple: to revolutionize hospitality on the internet.

 

Your Typical Day With Us

Assess & Test: Conduct vulnerability assessments and penetration tests on systems, networks, and applications.
Design Review: Review product designs and system architectures to identify security risks early using threat modeling.
Code Security: Perform source code reviews to detect flaws before deployment.
Incident Response: Investigate, analyze, and respond to security incidents and threats in a timely manner.
DevSecOps: Integrate automated security checks and testing into CI/CD pipelines for scalable security practices.
Guidance: Educate engineering teams through workshops and secure coding best practices.
Strategy: Analyze security metrics and trends to identify areas for improvement and adjust strategies accordingly.

 

What You’ll Need

3–5 years of experience in information security, network security, or a similar role.
Hands-on experience with threat and vulnerability management.
Proficiency in network and system security (Firewalls, IDS/IPS, VPNs).
Experience with security auditing tools and penetration testing.
Familiarity with security frameworks and regulations (e.g., NIST, ISO 27001, GDPR).

 

What Makes You Stand Out

Knowledge of cloud security concepts and experience working with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP).
Proficiency in scripting languages (Python, JavaScript, Golang) for automation.
Experience leading, executing, or coordinating security-related projects.
Relevant professional certifications (e.g., CISSP, CEH, CompTIA Security+, or GIAC).

 

Our Tech Stack

Languages: Go, Python, Elixir, TypeScript (React.js)
Infrastructure: Google Cloud Platform (GCP), Kubernetes, Terraform
Data & Search: MongoDB, MySQL, Postgres, BigQuery, Elasticsearch, Qdrant
CI/CD & Monitoring: GitHub Actions, ArgoCD, CircleCI, Grafana, Opsgenie

 

Perks & Benefits

Flexibility: Remote-first organization (in Japan) with interim work-from-overseas options.
Growth: Performance reviews twice a year and a competitive salary.
Support: Visa sponsorship and housing allowance (for those living within 1.5km of the office).
Time Off: 10 days annual leave (first year), 5 refreshment leave days, plus national and seasonal holidays.
Culture: Team building/lunch allowances and the "Zeals Bar" bi-monthly free-flow beer party.

 

Ready to roll up your sleeves?
We're obsessed with bringing hospitality to everyone. We promise a once-in-a-lifetime experience and coworkers you’ll be proud to brag about. If you're ready to change the status quo, join us!

title: Backend Developer
description:
About

We're looking for a backend engineer to design and build systems that power payment infrastructure. You'll own features end-to-end, from database schema design through deployment, and work alongside a small, tight-knit team of experienced engineers who ship fast and iterate constantly!

 

Responsibilities

Design, implement, and maintain high-performance backend services in Go.
Architect scalable data models and database schemas for new product features.
Build and operate workflow orchestration systems to handle complex payment sequences.
Identify and address technical debt while balancing rapid delivery timelines.
Participate in peer system design reviews and thorough code reviews.
Monitor, debug, and continuously improve overall system reliability.

 

Requirements

Experience: At least 1 year of professional backend software development experience.
Technical Proficiency: Strong proficiency in Golang and relational database design (PostgreSQL preferred).
Orchestration: Experience with workflow orchestration systems such as Temporal or AWS Step Functions.
System Design: Solid understanding of distributed systems patterns and architectural trade-offs.
Delivery: Proven track record of delivering stable features in production environments.
Documentation: Experience writing technical design docs, API specs, or SDK documentation.

 

Preferred Qualifications

2–5 years of professional software development experience.
Experience shipping a product from zero to production (strongly preferred).
Background in Fintech or Payments industries.
Familiarity with Infrastructure-as-Code (Terraform) and gRPC/Protocol Buffers.
Experience working in early-stage, fast-paced companies.
Familiarity with fullstack, mobile, or modern frontend frameworks.

title: Senior Software Engineer (Partner Product Development Department)
description:
Overview

You will be assigned to the Partner Product Development Department of Business Segment SMB Domain, responsible for overseeing the product line for partner professionals (accounting firms and labor and social security attorney offices) that make up a significant part of Money Forward Business Segment's business. The Partner Product Development Department aims to continuously solve various challenges faced by users in Japanese accounting firms. By advancing this project, we aim to improve the productivity of our crucial partners, increase the value they generate, and achieve mutual growth with Money Forward.

 

Responsibilities and Duties

The Cloud Partner Group sets forth the product vision of "advancing the advisory experience for professionals," recognizing the significant role professionals play in the growth of small and medium-sized businesses. However, a considerable amount of time is often spent on paper-based management tasks such as receipt management and various application form preparations, limiting resources for advisory services.

Promote the digital transformation of SMEs through our back-office SaaS series, Money Forward Cloud.
Extend new value to professionals, allowing them to direct more focus toward supporting the business growth of SMEs.
Employ Scrum development without dividing team roles between backend and frontend.
Transition to English as the primary language for development by fiscal year 2025.

 

Required Skills and Experience

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related technical field.
5+ years of web application development experience (application design, development, and operation).
Expertise in either React, Next.js, and GraphQL; Java/Server-side Kotlin and Springboot; or Ruby on Rails.
Experience with frontend and/or backend development in a full-stack web framework.
Experience in designing and deploying cloud infrastructure.
Willingness to work as a full-stack engineer, irrespective of technology or programming language.
Capable of relocating to Japan and commuting to the Tokyo office at least twice a week.

 

Preferred Skills and Experience

Conversational level in Japanese.
Experience with backend development using Ruby on Rails and RDBMS.
Experience in system architecture design, microservices, and microservice development.
Experience working in a Scrum team and practicing DevOps.
Experience in container-based development and proficiency in test-driven development.
Experience in AI development and/or experience in using AI tools to improve development processes.

 

Language Requirements

English: TOEIC score of 700 or above, plus the ability to handle meetings and text communication in English. (Equivalent qualifications like TOEFL iBT 60+, IELTS 5.0+, or Cambridge FCE are also accepted).
Japanese: No Japanese Language Requirement but willingness to learn. Conversational Japanese is a plus.

 

Technology Stack & Tools

Backend: Kotlin, GraphQL, Ruby on Rails
Frontend: React.js, Next.js, TypeScript
Middleware: MySQL, Kafka, Debezium
Infrastructure: AWS, Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform
CI/CD: CircleCI, GitHub Actions, Argo CD
Monitoring: Datadog, Rollbar
Management: JIRA, Slack, Zoom

 

Work Environment

Provided PC Specs: Latest CPU-equipped PCs (MacOS or Windows) with customization options based on requirements.
Development Support: Peripherals (displays, mice, keyboards) can be purchased as office supplies.
Money Forward Library: System to borrow or purchase technical/management books at the company's expense.
Professional Growth: Partial coverage for domestic and international conferences such as RubyKaigi and Google I/O.
Incentives: Referral reward system and coverage for recruitment meals.

title: Frontend Engineer (Android)
description:
About Mujin

Mujin creates MujinOS, the intelligent operating system for industrial robotics. By leveraging real-time digital twins, MujinOS seamlessly connects and orchestrates equipment to achieve fully autonomous operations.

At our core is Machine Intelligence (MujinMI), a unique approach offering advanced perception, planning, and control algorithms that solve the most challenging automation problems. Trusted by globally recognized companies, we are redefining supply chain efficiency. Headquartered in Japan with growing teams in China, the US, and Europe, we invite you to join a dynamic environment where you can shape the future of automation.

 

Team Introduction

As a Software Engineer on Mujin’s Warehouse Execution System (WES) & Fleet Management (FM) team, you will focus on developing user-facing Android and web frontend applications used daily in warehouse operations. Your work directly shapes how operators interact with warehouse systems through industrial Android devices and browser-based interfaces.

The team specializes in building reliable, high-quality frontends that run in demanding production environments, where stability, performance, and usability are critical. You will work closely with backend engineers, product managers, designers, and operations teams to deliver intuitive, responsive, and maintainable interfaces.

 

Responsibilities

Android

Design, develop, and maintain Android applications for industry devices used in warehouse environments.
Implement features that interface directly with device hardware layers (barcode scanners, cameras, physical buttons, NFC/RFID, Bluetooth, etc.).
Work with vendor-specific SDKs and build applications optimized for offline usage and long-running sessions.

Web Frontend

Develop web frontend applications using React and TypeScript.
Ensure applications are responsive, accessible, and optimized for performance across browsers and devices.

Collaboration & Quality

Collaborate with cross-functional teams (PMs, Designers, Backend, Ops).
Participate in code reviews, knowledge sharing, and mentoring.
Triage, debug, and resolve mission-critical production issues across Android and web systems.

 

Tech Stack

Android: Kotlin, React Native, Android SDK, Android Jetpack, AOSP-based devices.
Web Frontend: TypeScript, React, Rsbuild, Vitest, ESLint.
Backend & Infrastructure: Python, RESTful APIs, GraphQL, Docker.
Collaboration: Figma, Confluence, GitLab.

 

Requirements

Minimum Qualifications

3+ years of professional software development experience.
Professional experience developing Android applications using Kotlin and/or Java.
Strong knowledge of JavaScript, TypeScript, React, and CSS.
Experience integrating applications with device hardware features or SDKs.
Experience with testing frameworks and CI/CD pipelines.

Preferable Qualifications

Experience developing applications for industrial devices.
Proven experience maintaining shared frontend libraries or component systems.
Familiarity with PixiJS, rich animations, or interactive UIs.
Experience with offline-first design and data synchronization.

 

Work Environment & Benefits

Location: Tatsumi, Koto-Ku, Tokyo.
Work Hours: 8:45 - 17:45 (includes 60-minute break).
Salary: Based on experience; revision twice a year; performance bonuses available.
Food & Health: Free buffet lunch every workday, free snacks/drinks, and access to an exclusive employee gym.
Relocation Support: Visa sponsorship, flight ticket support, shipping expense coverage, and housing assistance.

 

Interview Process

Coding Assessment
HR Interview
Hiring Manager Interview (1-2 rounds)
Take-Home Assignment & Feedback (If applicable)

title: Growth Engineer
description:
What you’ll do
Rapidly design and implement lightweight technical solutions to test growth and product hypotheses in user-facing flows
Hack together and ship frontend-driven experiments and features that improve activation, conversion, or engagement
Implement A/B tests and instrumentation pragmatically, optimizing for learning speed while maintaining experiment validity
Iterate aggressively based on results, user feedback, and constraints, prioritizing impact over elegance when appropriate
 
Requirements
Strong frontend engineering skills, with clear ownership of user-facing features and product UI quality
Strong at implementing backend logic and API integrations, as needed.
Able to turn vague growth ideas into concrete, shippable technical solutions
Solid intuition for user behavior, funnels, and friction in real products
Data-literate: can write basic SQL to sanity-check outcomes and guide iteration
Bias toward speed and impact over perfect architecture
 
Experience
3–5+ years of experience building and iterating on products used by real users
Proven experience shipping frontend features used by real users, with iteration based on feedback or data
Experience with product iteration, growth-related work, or independent app development is a strong plus
 
Education
Bachelor’s degree or above. Practical skills, judgment, and shipped work matter more than formal credentials.
 
Nice to have
Interest in anime, otaku culture, creator communities, or related consumer products.
Interest in AI generation
 
Note:
If you've read this, please tell us the names of your top 5 favorite niche anime at the end of your message.

title: Security Specialist (CISO Office - Tokyo)
description:
Overview

At Money Forward, we develop a wide range of popular services, including our automated personal financial management tool "Money Forward ME" and the "Money Forward Cloud" suite for businesses. Our ecosystem is powered by advanced technologies such as "Account Aggregation" and our single sign-on system, "Money Forward ID."

As our services handle sensitive financial data, we maintain the highest standards of security. The CISO Office works closely with our business units to ensure and enhance the security of our products. This includes the governance and visualization of major cloud platforms like AWS and GCP, as well as the design, implementation, and operation of common security features such as WAF. Additionally, the CISO Office is responsible for strengthening the security of our internal information systems.

To provide a safe and secure experience for even more users, we are looking for a Security Specialist to join our team.

 

About the CISO Office

Our mission is to "Maximize the value delivered to our customers through security." We define and create the ideal security state for the entire Money Forward Group.

Preventing service downtime and information leakage is, of course, critical. However, that is only one part of what we value. Excessive security measures can slow down development, potentially reducing or delaying the value we provide to our customers. As security professionals, we constantly ask ourselves how we can maximize customer value and implement the most optimized security solutions to achieve that goal.

 

Security Principles

Embedded security in business strategy: We design security measures in alignment with business strategies, taking into account the current business phase, costs, and potential loss in the event of a risk.
Advanced balancing between security and experience: Over-securing can compromise user convenience. We assess risks to achieve a sophisticated balance between convenience and security, actively promoting automation and autonomous systems.
Autonomous and scalable organization of security: Each development department must be able to build secure services autonomously. The CISO Office focuses on building the frameworks and support necessary to enable this autonomy.

 

Responsibilities and Duties

In this position, you will leverage your knowledge and experience in coding and infrastructure to maintain and enhance the security of Money Forward in collaboration with developers and IT infrastructure teams. Key initiatives include:

Establishment of security guardrails for AWS, Azure, and GCP environments.
In-house security consulting: Providing technical advice and architecture reviews for our developers.
Vulnerability assessments and penetration testing: Performing or supporting security evaluations.
Vulnerability intelligence: Collecting and verifying vulnerability information, including OSINT.
Security tool development: Developing tools and scripts to automate or enhance security.
Framework implementation: Implementing and deploying security frameworks such as NIST CSF and CIS Controls.
DevSecOps implementation: Integrating security into modern development workflows (K8s, Docker, CI/CD).

 

Required Skills and Experience

Foundational understanding of computer science (networking, OS, data structures, and cryptography).
Experience in software development with at least one programming language, or hands-on experience practicing Security by Design.
Business-level English communication skills.
Knowledge or experience in any of the following areas:
Vulnerability assessment or Penetration testing
Forensics, malware analysis, or incident response
Cloud security or Architecture reviews
Building and operating DevSecOps workflows
Implementation of security solutions (e.g., WAF, IDS/IPS, SIEM)

 

Preferred Skills and Experience

Business-level Japanese communication skills.
Experience participating in CTFs, bug hunting, or obtaining CVEs.
Relevant certifications such as CISSP, CISM, OSCP, or GCIH.
Deep understanding of Authentication and Authorization (e.g., OIDC, OAuth).
Experience in security-related operations within the Financial or Fintech industry.
Experience in AI development or using AI tools to improve development processes.

 

Language Requirements

English: Business level

 

Work Environment

At Money Forward, we provide an environment where we can create world-class services together, and we are looking forward to welcoming you.

Provided PC Specs: Latest CPU-equipped PC (MacOS or Windows). Custom-made PCs tailored to business requirements are possible.
Systems to Enhance the Development Environment: Peripheral devices (displays, mice, keyboards) can be purchased as office supplies.
Money Forward Library: A library system where you can freely borrow or request books at the company's expense.
Referral Driven: Coverage for recruitment meals and a referral reward system.
Conference Participation Support: Partial coverage for domestic and international conferences like RubyKaigi and Google I/O.

title: Senior Software Engineer (C++ & Python)
description:
Mujin develops "MujinController," a platform that leverages a real-time digital twin and advanced robotics to seamlessly connect industrial equipment for fully autonomous operations.

Driven by our unique approach towards Robotics Machine Intelligence (MujinMI), we offer a robust suite of perception, planning, and control algorithms, enabling autonomous robot movement and transforming automation in challenging industrial environments.

Trusted by globally recognized companies, our cutting-edge technology enhances efficiency and innovation across the supply chain. With headquarters in Japan and expanding offices in China, the US, and Europe, Mujin offers a dynamic, fast-growing environment where your work directly shapes the future of automation.

 

Team Introduction

As a Software Engineer on Mujin's Warehouse Execution System (WES) & Fleet Management (FM) team, you will play a key role in designing, developing, and deploying Mujin’s advanced warehouse execution and fleet management systems. Our team works at the intersection of robotics, automation, and software engineering to optimize warehouse operations and ensure seamless orchestration of robots and industrial equipment.

 

Responsibilities

 Design, develop, and maintain WES software to manage warehouse inventory, scheduling, and order fulfillment.
 Implement and integrate drivers for industrial hardware, including robots, conveyors, 3D cameras, sensors, PLCs, AGVs, ASRS, and WMS.
 Work with real-time operating systems (RTOS) and network protocols to ensure system efficiency and low-latency communication.
 Ensure system security by implementing robust encryption and access control mechanisms.
 Design and optimize high-performance backend services and APIs for seamless integration with third-party warehouse software.
 Develop and enhance scalable HTTP servers to handle large-scale warehouse operations.
 Collaborate closely with backend and frontend teams to improve system usability and user experience.
 Maintain code quality and testing frameworks to ensure high system reliability.
 Occasionally travel to customer sites, both domestically and internationally, for deployment and support.
 Tackle complex technical challenges in a fast-paced environment.
 Take on additional tasks related to the above responsibilities as needed.

 

Minimum Requirements

BSc degree or higher in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related fields, or equivalent academic or work experience
Excellent experience and high proficiency in C++ and Python
Advanced Linux user, with excellent experience in Linux software development
Expert in Linux internals, networking stack, network protocols, routing, async I/O, Docker and its internal workings
Experience in full-stack development
Technical communication skills in English

 

Preferable Requirements

Expert in real-time OS, Linux kernel module development, EtherCAT
Experience in robotic software development

 

Attractiveness

We are looking for those who are prepared to dedicate themselves to facing big challenges, work proactively and independently, and take ownership when working with members across the teams!
You will get your “hands dirty” working on all aspects of the industrial robot controller, not being confined to a specific component in the system. The work is challenging, mostly like something that you have never done before, requiring extensive research.
Since the work is widely applicable, it will affect everyone in the engineering team, making the WES & FM team the likely “go-to” people. You will have chances to travel and work onsite to integrate cutting-edge industrial systems such as AGVs and ASRS.

title: Senior Full Stack Engineer
description:
About Us

Kamikai Labs is reimagining the future of 2D animation. Through our AI-powered suite of production tools, we help the world’s leading animation studios and indie creators ship higher-quality work faster than ever before. Our products are already in active use across top-tier Japanese studios, and we’re growing quickly as demand accelerates.

We’re now looking for a Senior or Staff Full-Stack Engineer, a strong generalist who loves shipping real products and owning problems end-to-end, to join our Tokyo-based team.

 

in applying to this job listing - please write only 1-3 bullet points about why you are an excellent fit.

 

About the Role

This is a product-driven, high-autonomy engineering role. You’ll work across the entire stack to design, build, and ship user-facing features used daily by professional animators and production teams. You’ll collaborate closely with designers, ML engineers, and founders, but you’ll also be trusted to independently take ideas from concept to production.

We’re looking for engineers who care deeply about shipping, have a strong JavaScript foundation, and can point to real products or systems they’ve built and delivered.

 

Key Responsibilities

Own features end-to-end: scoping, implementation, launch, iteration, and maintenance
Build and ship product-facing web applications with a strong focus on usability and performance
Develop and maintain backend APIs and services that support production workflows
Integrate ML inference endpoints and internal services via clean, reliable APIs
Move quickly in a scrappy environment — while progressively hardening systems for scale
Collaborate with designers and artists to ensure tools match real studio workflows
Improve product quality through thoughtful refactors, testing, and system design
Help shape engineering standards, architecture, and development velocity as the team grows

 

Requirements

Senior- or Staff-level experience as a full-stack engineer
Strong fluency in JavaScript and modern web development
Proven track record of shipping real products — personal projects, startups, or production systems
Comfortable working across frontend, backend, and infrastructure as needed
Experience building and consuming APIs (REST, WebSockets, etc.)
Strong product instincts: you think about users, edge cases, and long-term maintainability
Able to work autonomously, take ownership, and make pragmatic tradeoffs
English fluency required; Japanese is a bonus
Based in Japan or willing to relocate (relocation support provided)

 

Bonus Qualifications

Experience with modern frontend frameworks (React, Svelte, Next.js, etc.)
Backend experience in Node.js, Python, or similar
Familiarity with production databases (Postgres, Redis, etc.)
Experience scaling systems from early-stage to production-grade
Past work in creative tools, SaaS, or developer-facing products
Interest in animation, creative software, or artist workflows

 

Why Join Kamikai?

Ship real products used by some of the best animation studios in the world
High autonomy and ownership in a fast-moving, growing company
Work alongside a deeply creative, technical, and passionate team
Direct influence on product direction, engineering culture, and company trajectory
Competitive compensation, relocation support, and equity

title: Front-end Engineering Internship (Onsite Tokyo, Japan)
description:
COMPANY OVERVIEW

Established in 1996, HENNGE is one of the first IT ventures in Japan. Controlling a majority of the nation’s market share, we are the leading cloud-based security company based in Tokyo. We aim to become a world-class IT company by expanding our business globally, having English as our official language, and hiring international talents worldwide. We are looking for highly talented and motivated engineers (front-end, back-end, DevOps, mobile development) to join our team in Tokyo

 

Front-end Engineering Internship: Job Description

Ready for a Tech Adventure in Tokyo? Join Our Internship Program – 4-5 Weeks of Software Engineering Internship Await!

Join HENNGE’s Global Internship Program (GIP): Front-End Software Engineering Pathway in Tokyo, Japan. This unique 4-5 week internship at our Shibuya headquarters offers you personal and professional growth in an internationally diverse environment.

In HENNGE’s GIP: Front-end Engineering Pathway, you will acquire practical application development skills primarily in Typescript using React or Vue. GIP will provide you with hands-on experience using state-of-the-art cloud platforms such as Amazon Web Services and offer a real-world experience for application development.

Our primary working language is English, so no Japanese is required. The program is held at our Shibuya headquarters in Tokyo for 4-5 weeks, Monday to Friday, from 10 AM to 7 PM (JST). As the entire HENNGE’s engineering team is based in the same office, interns will have the opportunity to communicate directly with mentors and other engineers. While the program is unpaid, we provide comprehensive subsidies, and outstanding participants may be offered full-time employment opportunities.

If you are interested in HENNGE’s GIP: Full Stack Engineering Pathway, please check it out here.

Internship Overview

Build real-world applications using TypeScript with React or Vue.
Sharpen your skills in front-end frameworks while designing user experiences that matter.

Program Structure
Weeks 1-4: Application Development Project
Week 5: DevOps Project
Benefits 
Round-trip airfares from and back to your country of residence
Pre-arrival support and visa guidance
Medical insurance* and a phone with mobile data will be provided during your internship in Tokyo, Japan**
Up to 150,000 JPY of monthly subsidy to cover accommodation, meals, transportation, and networking activities
Subsidized company events on top of monthly subsidy (Monthly Technical Sessions, Board Game Night, Get-to-know-you Lunches, and many others!) to get to know teams across divisions
Access to online learning platform during the internship period

* Medical insurance will only be provided to interns who do not reside in Japan
** This internship is an unpaid training program with a subsidy provided to all interns

Essential Qualifications
Third-year undergraduate or higher (including Master's and Doctoral students). Recent graduates are also welcome to apply
Pursuing or holding a degree in Computer Science or a related field. If not, equivalent experience from a tech internship or bootcamp is expected
Fluency in English (Japanese not required)
Proficiency in frontend frameworks such as React or Vue in Typescript, preferably with knowledge of the nuances of building at scale such as form validation, data fetching and state management
Knowledge of Linux / MacOS / Unix-like environments
Interested in open source or tech community activities
Interested in pursuing a career in Japan

At least meet three of the following:

Experience in cloud computing platforms, especially AWS
Experience in full stack web application development
Proficiency in Python or Go
Knowledge of distributed systems
Knowledge of DevOps tools and practices (CI/CD, Infrastructure as Code)
Experience in software testing methodologies (unit testing, integration testing, end-to-end testing)
Experience with UI/UX design tools, especially Figma
Experience implementing responsive web design in a web app
Experience implementing SSO in a web app
Our Ideal Candidate

Our ideal candidate is more than just a front-end developer - they’re a curious builder with a broad technical perspective. We're especially excited about applicants who:

Have experience in back-end or full stack development
Are familiar with DevOps practices and tools like CI/CD pipelines or cloud services
Understand the value of thoughtful UI/UX design
Bring a well-rounded approach to building complete, user-focused products

Bring your range - we want to see the full picture of what you can do.

Internship schedule

We open batches multiple times a year.

Available batch (as of Dec 26)

Batch 5 (2026): Nov 16 - Dec 18 (5 weeks) 
How to apply
Register through the apply button below and verify your email address.
Solve the coding challenge and submit your work with your CV and cover letter.
An HR interview followed by an online interview, will be given to those who pass Step 2.

Notice for Applicants

A limited number of internship slots are available. Applications will be reviewed as they are received, and positions will be filled on a first-come, first-served basis.  We encourage you to apply early, as applications will close once all positions are filled.
The coding challenge has no time limit, and the screening process will not consider solving time. Please note that the application is completed after uploading application documents and filling in the batch preferences.
Please take another challenge if you are (also) interested in applying for HENNGE’s GIP: Full Stack Engineering Pathway. Please use different emails to sign up if you apply for both internships.

title: Full Stack Engineer
description:
Description

About AIRoA

The AI Robot Association (AIRoA) is launching a groundbreaking initiative: collecting one million hours of humanoid robot operation data with hundreds of robots, and leveraging it to train the world’s most powerful Vision-Language-Action (VLA) models.

What makes AIRoA unique is not only the unprecedented scale of real-world data and humanoid platforms, but also our commitment to making everything open and accessible. We are building a shared “robot data ecosystem” where datasets, trained models, and benchmarks are available to everyone. Researchers around the world will be able to evaluate their models on standardized humanoid robots through our open evaluation platform.

 

For researchers, this means an opportunity to:

Work on fundamental challenges in robotics and AI: multimodal learning, tactile-rich manipulation, sim-to-real transfer, and large-scale benchmarking.
Access state-of-the-art infrastructure: hundreds of humanoid robots, GPU clusters, high-fidelity simulators, and a global-scale evaluation pipeline.
Collaborate with leading experts across academia and industry, and publish results that will shape the next decade of robotics.
Contribute to an initiative that will redefine the future of embodied AI—with all results made open to the world.

 

Key Responsibilities

Design, develop and implement teleoperation systems, including real‑time control, low‑latency audio/video streaming and operator-facing interfaces.
Work closely with robot operators to gather feedback from real‑world use and continuously improve the user experience.
Provide data‑quality feedback through the teleoperation UI to encourage higher‑quality data collection.
Develop and maintain applications that support data collection, such as internal tools and dashboards.
Build intuitive web‑based interfaces for managing and monitoring data pipelines.
Collaborate with VLA teams and Data/ML platform teams to ensure seamless data ingestion and workflow management.
Design and implement APIs to facilitate data interactions between internal services and external data sources.
Develop configuration‑management systems to store and update metadata, including robot configurations and task descriptions.
Ensure secure communication through robust authentication and access‑control mechanisms.

 

Requirements

Required Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related field (or equivalent practical experience).
4+ years of professional experience as a full‑stack engineer.
Proficiency in frontend frameworks such as Next.js, React or Vue.
Proficiency in implementing backend solutions using such technologies as Go and Python FastAPI.

 

Preferred Qualifications

Experience developing real-time dashboards, robot control interfaces, or similar applications.
Experience with web crawling and large-scale data processing is a plus.
Familiarity with cloud platforms such as AWS, GCP or Azure.
Strong understanding of web/mobile app development and real‑time communication protocols (WebSocket, MQTT, gRPC).
Experience with ROS/ROS2 and related web tools (e.g., ROSBridge, Foxglove, Webviz).
Familiarity with robot telemetry, sensor data visualization, and live camera feeds.
Experience optimizing system performance using performance analysis tools.

 

Benefits

There are currently no comparable projects in the world that collect data and develop foundation models on such a large scale. As mentioned above, this is one of Japan’s leading national projects, supported by a substantial investment of 20.5 billion yen from NEDO.

This position will play a crucial role in determining the success of the project. You will have broad discretion and responsibility, and we are confident that, if successful, you will gain both a great sense of achievement and the opportunity to make a meaningful contribution to society.

Furthermore, we strongly encourage engineers to actively build their careers through this project—for example, by publishing research papers and engaging in academic activities.
